Author: princess-kitty-belle
Text: It's normal to have slip-ups in recovery, but your reaction to it is what's important here. You can either let it turn into a relapse, or try again.  It's also pretty understandable that it would feel really familiar and automatic to purge- likely you've been purging for longer than 30 days, so it's gonna take a while to break that cycle.

Author: ame-chii
Text: anyways. feeling like Boo Boo the Fucking Fool rn and i don’t know what to do. i know the path to recovery is hard but it’s so, so easy to relapse and now that i’ve done it i know i’m gonna do it again. logic brain says “one relapse doesn’t hurt the progress you’ve made this month” but monky brain says “if you eat, you gotta yeet”
